messageBody:
Hi!

I was attracted by Vladimirs JUNIT-Add-on when i saw PrivateAccessor and
DirectorySuiteBuilder.

I tried to use DirectorySuiteBuilder to have a Suite Builder/runner,
whose input would be to take package name and the test filter class,
based on these params, it should search for all valid testcase in the
same package as well all the subpackages and run the tests. This runner
should extract the tests either from jar file package or file system
class in a transparent way unlike two separate classes as in
JUNIT-ADD-on i.e DirectorySuiteBuilder and ArchiveSuiteBuilder..

By doing this, i would be eliminating all the TestXYZPackageSuite class
which has suite method. This suite method creates a Test out all the
package classes and includes suites of sub packages.

I tried write some thing on my own using JUNIT-Addon's but looks like
DirectorySuiteBuilder expects the directory in a similar lines of class
path, i.e if there is java class in
/home/classes/com/sun/rewriter/util/Parser.class then i need to give
directory name as /home/classes and not
/home/classes/com/sun/rewriter/util/.

I would still believe that this could be achieved by doing some
modifications to DirectorySuiteBuilder, but i would be glad it this
feature gets into JUNIT-Add-ons as this could do away Suite class which
are needed (as good practice) for every package.

Vladimir R. Bossicard could please help..I have also attached code which
was written using you API in JUNIT-Add-ons, could please see what i am
missing...

Thanking you in advance..

Regards,
Nagendra
